data.title: Sandy Lam - University of California, San Diego - New York, New York, United States
data.meta_description: Education: University of California, San Diego · Location: New York · 500+ connections on LinkedIn. View Sandy Lam’s profile on LinkedIn, a professional community of 1 billion members.
data.text:
• Founded a nonprofit organization to promote educational opportunities for underprivileged children in Cambodia

‌• Constructed 2 classrooms and 1 restroom in Takeo Province as well as provided $400+ in scholarships, writing instruments, notebooks, textbooks, and bicycles to further education for 250+ rural children

‌• Coordinated match donation programs with representatives from Google, Verizon, and the co-founder of Guitar Hero for $6,000+

• Founded a nonprofit organization to promote educational opportunities for underprivileged children in Cambodia

‌• Constructed 2 classrooms and 1 restroom in Takeo Province as well as provided $400+ in scholarships, writing instruments, notebooks, textbooks, and bicycles to further education for 250+ rural children

‌• Coordinated match donation programs with representatives from Google, Verizon, and the co-founder of Guitar Hero for $6,000+

‌• Contacted over 150 members of the Cambodian community in the Bay Area and arranged a benefit dinner with performances, raffles, and games at Congregation Beth Am in Los Altos Hills with over 200 guests to raise $5,000+

‌• Raised a total of $20,000+ for Angroun Elementary School in Angroun Village in Takeo Province, Cambodia

• Founded Branham High School’s first business organization to help expose students to different business industries • Grew membership from 5 to 30 within 2 years through marketing campaigns and social media platforms • Organized weekly meetings to learn and teach topics related to management, finance, hospitality, and marketing to prepare for the Silicon Valley Career Development Conference (SVCDC) in Santa Clara, California • Coordinated competition enrollment for 20+ members at 2 annual…

• Founded Branham High School’s first business organization to help expose students to different business industries • Grew membership from 5 to 30 within 2 years through marketing campaigns and social media platforms • Organized weekly meetings to learn and teach topics related to management, finance, hospitality, and marketing to prepare for the Silicon Valley Career Development Conference (SVCDC) in Santa Clara, California • Coordinated competition enrollment for 20+ members at 2 annual SVCDC where 3 members won awards for high marks for the Hospitality and Tourism Exam and Business Services Operations Research Project
